question: I have had type 2 diabetes for the last 6 years which is hereditary in my family.  I also have high blood pressure and high cholesterol, which I treat with medications.  I am a farmer, and the last several weeks we have been in the fields most every day, and when I come home in the evenings I have been eating something a little salty and sugary before bed.  I have woken up the past 2 nights in the middle of the night with numbness in my left hand which is painful.  I sit up and try my best to get it to wake up, and it usually takes about 40 minutes before I get full feeling back?  Is there a reason other than the foods I have eaten before bed that could be causing this, it is painful and I don't get much sleep when it occurs.
title: Numbness in hands
